Work Experience

Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Developer — eBay (January 2014-present)

From D3.js to Docker, I have worked across the engineering spectrum in eBay's Cloud Infrastructure and Platform Services organization. I am currently working on eBay's Kubernetes implementation, adapting the open source Kubernetes Dashboard to suit eBay's infrastructure needs.

Cloud Engineering Intern — eBay (June 2013 - September 2013)

I developed and supported several features for an internal monitoring tool for eBay's OpenStack Cloud.

Operations IaaS Intern — eBay (June 2012 - September 2012)

I developed features for an internal VM Provisioning & Remediation tool.

Skills

Javascript & ES 6/7

On the web side, I have extensive experience with AngularJS 1.x and D3 3.x. As for the backend, I have written several small projects in NodeJS, using Express 4 for writing web services.

Sass & CSS

I write rich, reusable web components with Sass. I am comfortable working in any design language, and I love to experiment. I have designed components for seamless visual integration with Material Design, Metro, and vanilla Bootstrap.

Modern Web Development Toolchain

I work with npm and bower to manage project dependencies, and write build tasks using Gulp. View the source of this site to check out some example project setup code, or fork my base repo if you want to easily reuse this setup.

Docker & Containerization

I have extensive experience containerizing applications for running on a Kubernetes deployment. I am comfortable deploying a service from start to finish on any docker setup.

Unix Environments

I work just fine with a shell (preferably zsh), and I can apt-get, curl, and pipe like a pro.
